name: Arsenal FC History Quiz | Arsenal | 10 Questions

questions.text: When did the club become known as Arsenal?
questions.explanation:
1914.

	Arsenal were first named Dial Square in 1886, but quickly changed their name to Royal Arsenal. In 1893, they joined the football league second division under a new name, Woolwich Arsenal and kept that name until 1914.

questions.text: Which ground did the club, become known as Arsenal first play?
questions.explanation:
Plumstead Common.

	The club began life at Plumstead Common in 1885, and moved to the Sportman Ground two years later in 1887. After just one year they moved to the Manor Ground until 1890, when they moved into the Invicta Ground. They stayed there for three years before moving back to the Manor Ground until 1913, when they moved into Highbury Stadium.

questions.text: In what year did Arsenal win their first league title?
questions.explanation:
1931.

	Arsenal took their first title with 66 points, seven ahead of second placed Aston Villa who had 59. Leeds United and Manchester United were relegated this year.

questions.text: Which of these set a record in 1934-35 for the most goals in a season?
questions.explanation:
Ted Drake.

	Ted Drake scored 42 goals in the 1934-35 season, as Arsenal finished champions for the fourth time in their history.

questions.text: How many goals did Cliff Bastin score in his Arsenal career?
questions.explanation:
178.

	Bastin set the record between 1929-36, when he scored 178 goals in 395 games, and it stood until Ian Wright scored 185 goals in 288 games between 1991-98.

questions.text: Which of these did Arsenal achieve in the 1934-35 season?
questions.correct: Won the title for the third season in a row
options: Won the title for the fourth season in a row
Were relegated from the first division and won the FA Cup
Won the title and the FA Cup
questions.explanation:
Won the title for the third season in a row.

	Arsenal won their fourth title with 58 points, four ahead of second placed Sunderland who had 54.

questions.text: Which of following played the most times for Arsenal?
questions.explanation:
David O'Leary.

	O'Leary began his Arsenal career in 1977, and ended it when he moved to Leeds United sixteen years later in 1993. During that time, he played 722 games for the club and scored 14 goals.

questions.text: Which club did Arsenal sign Robert Pires from?
questions.explanation:
Olympique Marseilles.

	Pires began his career at Metz in 1992, and stayed there until he transferred to Marseilles in 1998, where he played two seasons before joining Arsenal.

questions.text: Who was Arsenal's first manager in their history?
questions.explanation:
Sam Hollis.

	Hollis managed the club between 1894-97, and left to join Bristol City who he managed for 16 years.

questions.text: On March 12, 1900, Arsenal set a record by beating Loughborough Town. What was the score?
questions.explanation:
12-0.

	Arsenal avenged an 8-0 defeat by the same club in 1896. Thanks for taking this quiz.
